I've had this game sitting in my library for almost 3 years now, and now that I've put a (at time of writing) 24h into killer I can absolutely say this is one of the worst new player experiences i've ever had the misfortune of sitting through, and I've played Warframe so consider that.

You start with no upgrades aside from a base 3 of whatever character you're playing survivor or killer, and most perks are so situation dependant that you'll never find a use for them. There is a pool of about 10 perks spread across 8 or 9 killers that are absolutely mandatory. Barbeque and Chili, corrupt intervention, hex:ruins, discordance to name a few. it takes around 7 to 8 hours of gameplay to get a killer to a rank where you unlock that perk for the POSSIBILITY of appearing in the unlock screen of another killer.
Yep you don't even get the perk you unlocked for other killers, you have to pray to RNGeesus that it shows up. I can personally attest to watching a friend of mine (who has hundreds of hours in the game) fully prestige a killer looking for a single instance of one of those necessary perks.

Oh my god, the ranked system is so terrible. I was catapulted to rank 12 by the second day because I don't know why, and now I've been put up against multiple high-tiered players back to back. Under no circumstances should a person who has been playing for 2 days, and is still only using a single perk EVER be put against the highest possible tier of player.

It really doesn't help that there is no 'non-ranked' format. You do not have the luxury of playing casually.

I could honestly ignore most of these, and chalk it up to a fringe case of maybe queuing at a bad time with low population count, or they've just focused their resources elsewhere rather than smoothing out the leveling curve for someone like me, but no, the game breaks when you introduce the scariest concept of them all:

Friendship.
Survivors on discord or VOIP will fucking decimate you when you play killer. Imagine a horror movie where all the stupid college students could telepathically talk to each other even after death, that's what you're dealing with. The game is HEAVILY weighed in favor of survivors and being able to instantly share vital information completely breaks the game.
I've seen the Otzdarva videos, and I know his stance on Survive with Friends, but I cannot agree, not everyone has thousands of hours in the game or has thousands of hours to dedicate. 

It doesn't work, fix it.

After 3 years of owning this game, I can safely say that this game is not worth the 20$ price tag, it is far too frustrating to play for long sessions solo. The game's learning curve and community at times can be extremely helpful or toxic. No matter what happens in this game, you will get mad. The hitboxes are worst than league. It has the same issue league has with matchmaking. So why play this game?... The only reason I find purpose from playing this game is with other people, the killer experience is a true nightmare, soloqueing has an issue that if there's a sfw, the solo is likely to get neglected. Furthermore, as a long time player it truly makes me sad to get certain maps reworked in the way they do, to this extent it can be fine if key parts of the map remain the same, however when it's to the extent of autohaven I believe that the extra effort spent could be better used for fixing the hitboxes or anything other than skins. On another topic skins are far too polar, it is likely that a person who keeps this game as a hobby will never see an earned iridescent shard skin. Perks and addons are always either broken or completely outmatched. Certain addons combos make a reward unearned, see iridescent head and military belt. Certain play styles have a lack of counterplay, such as tunneling and camping, when they do, it is usually in the form of deciding a whole perk on 1 situation. Ultimately it is sad, as this is the only game of its kind, Deathgarden took a death to it's playerbase, Friday the 13th drowned itself, and Last Year was dead the moment it released on Discord. Despite this the developers are decided to addressing these concerns, but I believe no change will happen soon. 
The main point is buy this game on sale and play it with friends. Casually it is just a game to play while talking with friends. Competitively you'll be ripping your hair out. And in rank hell, it's just disappointing and lacks the foundation that should be in all games, fun.

Dead by Daylight is one of my favorite games to play on PlayStation, Switch & PC. It is a great multi-player to play Survivors with friends or solo as Killer. :)

TLDR: 
If you have never played this game before, you should skip it. 
If you don't have friends to play this game with, skip it. 
Unless you plan on grinding this game forever to be viable. This game is a huge waste of time. This game is made so players who have been playing forever can have loadouts that are impossible to play against.

The matchmaking is atroicious. As a newer player, I don't have most of the good perks. More often than not, I'd encounter players with full perks and many teachables from other characters with full blown addons, skeleton keys and what not. I don't have shit besides the starting perks. How am I suppose to play anything when the skill gap is already so large? 
As a killer, due to not having any good slow down perks or tracker perks, the survivors literally complete the map before I even hook the first survivor. Like come on, how are any new players suppose to learn this game. And when I do find a survivor, it's that one guy that has all the escaping perks that's meant to lead you around the map forever.  
Fix the trash matchmaking. Why am I fighting multiple red tiers when i'm still rank 18. 

It also doesn't help when I'm clearly playing against a four stack, like seriously, these guys show up and body block, take protection hits, and are clearly out of my league. 

I get that most games have a steep learning curve and that's okay. But, how am I suppose to learn anything when a four stack just teabags me all game and there's not much I can do about it? The match is over in five minutes. There needs to be a buff to the killer when playing against a group. Something like 5% speed boost and recovery boost per player that is in a group would be good.  

There needs to be a MMR attached to each account instead of going off ranks that reset every month. There's literally rank 20s that have everything in the game and just faceroll you. 

I've looked up guides and shit to improve my play and it has, however, it still doesn't help that I don't have any of the teachables that I would need to be at least viable. The shrine of secrets should be rehashed so new players can always at least get hex ruin or something. Overall, this game is extremely unfriendly to newer players. 

If anything, most of the commonly used teachables should probably be made baseline in the game. It took me about a day of grinding to unlock teachables for one killer. It's so insanely grindy just so I can have a decent chance in this game. 

The only reason I can think of where you might get this game is if you have friends to play with. Otherwise, if you are a solo player. Skip this game entirely.
Too many people that ruin the game with camping and tunneling. Almost 90% of this community is toxic...
